classes module

class classes.Course(course_id: str, course_name: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a Course.

The Course class holds information about a course, including the course ID, name, assigned instructor, and enrolled students. It also provides methods to add students to the course and serialize the course data into a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – A unique identifier for the course.

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

Raises:

Exception – If the course ID is invalid (must be a non-negative integer).

add_student(student)[source]

Add a student to the course.

This method adds a student to the course’s enrolled students list and registers the course with the student’s registered courses.

Parameters:

student (Student) – The student to add to the course.

Raises:

AssertionError – If the provided object is not of type Student.

Returns:

None

serializing_function()[source]

Serialize the course details into a dictionary.

This method returns a dictionary representation of the course, including the course ID, name, instructor, and a list of enrolled students by their student IDs.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the course details.

Return type:

dict

class classes.Instructor(name: str, age: int, _email: str, instructor_id: str)[source]

Bases: Person

A class representing an Instructor, which is a subclass of Person.

The Instructor class extends the Person class with additional attributes like instructor_id and assigned courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The instructor’s name.

  • age (int) – The instructor’s age, must be a non-negative integer.

  • _email (str) – The instructor’s email address.

  • instructor_id (str) – A unique identifier for the instructor.

Raises:

Exception – If the age, email, or instructor ID is invalid.

assign_course(course)[source]

Assign the instructor to a course.

This method assigns the instructor to a course.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course object to assign.

Raises:

AssertionError – If the provided object is not of type Course.

class classes.Person(name: str, age: int, _email: str)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing a Person.

The Person class holds information about a person, including their name, age, and email address. The email and age are validated using the provided validate_email and validate_numbers functions.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the person.

  • age (int) – The age of the person, must be a non-negative integer.

  • _email (str) – The email address of the person.

Raises:

Exception – If the age or email is invalid.

introduce()[source]

Print an introduction of the person.

This method prints the person’s name, age, and email address.

serializing_function()[source]

Serialize the person’s details into a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the person’s name, age, and email.

Return type:

dict

class classes.Student(name: str, age: int, _email: str, student_id: str)[source]

Bases: Person

A class representing a Student, which is a subclass of Person.

The Student class extends the Person class with additional attributes like student_id and registered courses.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The student’s name.

  • age (int) – The student’s age, must be a non-negative integer.

  • _email (str) – The student’s email address.

  • student_id (str) – A unique identifier for the student.

Raises:

Exception – If the age, email, or student ID is invalid.

register_course(course)[source]

Register the student for a course.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course object to register for.

Raises:

AssertionError – If the provided object is not of type Course.

classes.validate_email(email: str)[source]

Validate an email address.

This function uses a regular expression to check if the provided email address has a valid format (something like user@example.com).

Parameters:

email (str) – The email address to validate.

Raises:

Exception – If the email is not in a valid format or is empty.

Returns:

None

classes.validate_numbers(num: int)[source]

Validate a numeric value to ensure it is non-negative and of type integer.

This function checks if the input is a valid integer and that it is greater than zero. If the input is invalid or negative, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

num (int) – The number to validate.

Raises:

Exception – If the input is not a non-negative integer.

Returns:

The validated number.

Return type:

int
